0.user_question: A fog bank rolls in from the ocean to cover a city. It takes 10 minutes to cover every 3 miles of the city. If the city is 42 miles across from the oceanfront to the opposite inland edge, how many minutes will it take for the fog bank to cover the whole city?

direct_answer.text: Let's think step by step. Every 3 miles, it takes 10 minutes to roll in the fog bank. The length of the city is 42 miles. We can find out how many 3 mile sections make up this distance by dividing 42 miles by 3 miles per section. 42 / 3 = 14 sections. So the total time it takes to roll into the whole city is 14 times 10 minutes (for each section). This equals 140 minutes or 2 hours and 20 minutes. The answer is: 140.
